meanings.definition: To surpass in brightness or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The sun's rays outglare the dim moonlight.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks outglare the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight outglared the glow of the fireflies, making them jealous.
meanings.sent4: Her smile outglared the neon sign, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse outglared the storm, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.definition: To stare fiercely or angrily at someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher outglared the misbehaving student, demanding attention.
meanings.sent2: The cat outglared the dog, asserting dominance in the room.
meanings.sent3: The toddler outglared his vegetables, determined not to eat them.
meanings.sent4: The rival outglared his opponent, ready for the showdown.
meanings.sent5: The boss outglared the employees, expecting them to work harder.
